review: best open world series of this kind . all three of them .
review_bomb_reason: Kurz nach Beginn des Russland-Ukraine-Krieges im Februar 2022 entschieden sich einige Spieleentwickler dazu, sich klar gegen Russland zu positionieren, indem sie entweder ihre Spiele nicht mehr in Russland zum Verkauf anboten, z.B. CD Projekt Red (CDPR), ihre Spiele nicht mehr mit Rubel bezahlt werden konnten, z.B. die “S.T.A.L.K.E.R.” - Serie, oder direkt Geld an die Ukraine spendeten (Entwickler von “This War of Mine” und “Frostpunk”). Dadurch fühlten sich vor allem russische Spieler hintergangen oder zu Unrecht bestraft. Aber auch andere Spieler beteiligten sich am Review Bombing, da sie der Meinung waren, dass sich Spieleentwickler aus politischen Angelegenheiten heraushalten sollten.
game_description: S.T.A.L.K.E.R.: Call of Pripyat is the direct sequel of the S.T.A.L.K.E.R.: Shadow of Chernobyl. As a Major Alexander Degtyarev you should investigate the crash of the governmental helicopters around the Zone and find out, what happened there.
text_cleaned: best open world series of this kind . all three of them .
text_preprocessed: well open world series of this kind . all three of they .

game_description: Cyberpunk 2077 is an open-world, action-adventure story set in Night City, a megalopolis obsessed with power, glamour and body modification. Assume the role of V, a mercenary outlaw going after a one-of-a-kind implant that is the key to immortality. You can customize your character’s cyberware, skillset and playstyle, and explore a vast city where the choices you make shape the story and the world around you. Become a cyberpunk, an urban mercenary equipped with cybernetic enhancements and build your legend on the streets of Night City. Take the riskiest job of your life and go after a prototype implant that is the key to immortality.

review: A very solid and addicting card game. It's not really pay to win as well, you will get the cards you want eventually as long as you keep progressing, opening free kegs and getting those daily rewards. Find a faction that really suits your play style when you first start playing the game. Eventually, you will find interesting ways how to counter the other factions.

review:
I would have given it an 8/10 on release. My initial experience was mostly bug free and exceptionally fun.
The recent patches and updates have given me cause to revisit the game and so far it has been flawless.
I wouldn't usually take time to review a game but I heard this was getting review bombed for stupid reasons and I wanted to voice support.

review: This game is one of the greatest open world, RPG, singleplayer campaingn of all time. The graphics of this game are beautiful and will age well in time. The choices you make in this game do mater and will greatly change the outcome of your playthrouth. The Dev's of the time that made this game really put a lot of attention into detail to enrich your experience. The gameplay and the camera of this game are top noch compared to the previous entries. There's plenty of replayability and it definitely recommanded to have multiple playthrouth's of this game.

review: Are you releasing a raw, unfinished game in which, after a year and a half, nothing has changed, and moreover, your games are now part of the political system? I'm from the Luhansk People's Republic, and I bought your games just to support your company in a difficult moment! And you acted so vilely, you didn’t give a damn about people, this is evident not only from the ban, but also from the quality of the game itself. I am very sorry that I supported you at that time, and I will never buy another game from your hypocritical company again! You hypocrites!

review: The technical aspects of this game is a mess. Could not finish because of bugs. Unbalanced mess too. Only the most hardcore gamers would like this game. I just want to enjoy the ride...
review_bomb_reason: Kurz nach Beginn des Russland-Ukraine-Krieges im Februar 2022 entschieden sich einige Spieleentwickler dazu, sich klar gegen Russland zu positionieren, indem sie entweder ihre Spiele nicht mehr in Russland zum Verkauf anboten, z.B. CD Projekt Red (CDPR), ihre Spiele nicht mehr mit Rubel bezahlt werden konnten, z.B. die “S.T.A.L.K.E.R.” - Serie, oder direkt Geld an die Ukraine spendeten (Entwickler von “This War of Mine” und “Frostpunk”). Dadurch fühlten sich vor allem russische Spieler hintergangen oder zu Unrecht bestraft. Aber auch andere Spieler beteiligten sich am Review Bombing, da sie der Meinung waren, dass sich Spieleentwickler aus politischen Angelegenheiten heraushalten sollten.
game_description: The events of S.T.A.L.K.E.R.: Call of Pripyat unfold shortly after the end of S.T.A.L.K.E.R.: Shadow of Chernobyl. Having discovered about the open path to the Zone center, the government decides to hold a large-scale military "Fairway" operation aimed to take the CNPP under control. According to the operation's plan, the first military group is to conduct an air scouting of the territory to map out the detailed layouts of anomalous fields location. Thereafter, making use of the maps, the main military forces are to be dispatched. Despite thorough preparations, the operation fails. Most of the avant-garde helicopters crash. In order to collect information on reasons behind the operation failure, Ukraine's Security Service send their agent into the Zone center. From now on everything depends on the player. [GSC GameWorld]

review: Beautiful presentation and mechanics that are fresh and different compared to any other CCG I've played. If you like PvP deckbuilders (there isn't any SP content to speak of - check out Thronebreaker or the Gwent minigame in W3 for that), definitely check this one out. I'm only 8 hours in, so I have no idea if it's pay-to-win at the higher ranks (although, who cares if it is, as long as it's not pay-to-have-interesting-decisions-to-make), but you can definitely win some matches and gain at least a few ranks when you're just starting out without paying anything. Then again, with gameplay this fun and production values this good, you'd be churlish not to give them a few bucks at some point.

review: This creation of the developers, who miraculously managed to make this "masterpiece", received the approval of the players only thanks to the world thought out for them and the characters that already existed. review:
Overall they fixed a lot the main issues that plagued this game from the start. It's playable now and on a 3070 I can play the game maxed out with RTX also maxed out at 30 stable with DLSS on balanced. Overall an amazing game. The story is interesting and has a fun open world to explore. I will break this game down into two sections, Pros and Cons.
Pros:
- Amazing graphics 
- Amazing sound
- Great Story(I will touch on this in the con sections)
- Tons of cool weapons and great selection of ways to massacre your enemies
- Amazing Perk and Skill trees
Cons: 
- Ending feels kinda rushed
- Enemy factions don't have a role at all in free roam 
- Limited number of side missions that are fun
- Story is short only around 20 hours
- Cars feel more like tanks 
- Dialog for NCPs is limited
- No real end goal other than to beat story
Overall I would say get this game when it's on sale. I do hope they add some sort of DLC to the game to add more to the story as its kinda lack luster right now. But pretty fun game with a lot of potential.

Dadurch fühlten sich vor allem russische Spieler hintergangen oder zu Unrecht bestraft. Aber auch andere Spieler beteiligten sich am Review Bombing, da sie der Meinung waren, dass sich Spieleentwickler aus politischen Angelegenheiten heraushalten sollten.

game_description: Cyberpunk 2077 is an open-world, action-adventure story set in Night City, a megalopolis obsessed with power, glamour and body modification. Assume the role of V, a mercenary outlaw going after a one-of-a-kind implant that is the key to immortality. You can customize your character’s cyberware, skillset and playstyle, and explore a vast city where the choices you make shape the story and the world around you. Become a cyberpunk, an urban mercenary equipped with cybernetic enhancements and build your legend on the streets of Night City. Take the riskiest job of your life and go after a prototype implant that is the key to immortality.

review:
This is a hard one to review. The game is very unforgiving and explains very little; allied with the fact that your first weapons are incredibly imprecise, and you get a frustrating start.
But later, once you get nicer weapons and start to understand the game's systems, it becomes a lot of fun. Though your character does not "level up", the loot and quest systems make this feel a lot like a RPG. The game can still kill you quickly, but this is a minor drawback if you QuickSave/QuickLoad a lot. Moreover, the A.I. is quite varied (sometimes the enemies come looking for you, but often they patiently wait around a corner or behind cover; they often speak, but some of them are silent), which makes the fights exciting and tense.
The story is... weird. It reminds me of Indigo Prophecy, in the sense that some things happen that just seem randomly "grafted" into the plot for no good reason -- some story bits felt like they belonged to another post-apocalyptic game, with cutscenes disjointed from the gameplay bits. This is one of the few games where the "bad" endings are more interesting than the "true" ones.
Another technical complaint: someone has to tell developers (even the "Witcher 3" folks) that encumbrance in videogames is not fun! I get that it is unrealistic to lug around more than 60Kg while you are shooting, jumping and running, but walking miles just to stash your valuables is really boring.
But anyway, the star of the game is atmosphere -- outdoor scenes change from a breezy day to stormy and back, and some of the interiors are quite scary (X18 and X16 are awesome in that regard). The ticking of Geiger counters and anomaly proximity alerts can keep you on your toes, and reinforce the idea of "invisible dangers" all around you. It is really impressive how other stalkers walk around, fight monsters whether you are near or not, factions fight each other with or without your interference... This makes this dead world very lively, and, for me, this was the best aspect of the game.
Score: 81/100.
Notes: I played the game in "Stalker" difficulty, and used only one mod/patch, the "Zone Reclamation Project", in order to get rid of the nastiest bugs.

CD Projekt Red (CDPR), ihre Spiele nicht mehr mit Rubel bezahlt werden konnten, z.B. die “S.T.A.L.K.E.R.” - Serie, oder direkt Geld an die Ukraine spendeten (Entwickler von “This War of Mine” und “Frostpunk”). game_description: Cyberpunk 2077 is an open-world, action-adventure story set in Night City, a megalopolis obsessed with power, glamour and body modification. Assume the role of V, a mercenary outlaw going after a one-of-a-kind implant that is the key to immortality. You can customize your character’s cyberware, skillset and playstyle, and explore a vast city where the choices you make shape the story and the world around you. Become a cyberpunk, an urban mercenary equipped with cybernetic enhancements and build your legend on the streets of Night City. Take the riskiest job of your life and go after a prototype implant that is the key to immortality.

CD Projekt Red (CDPR), ihre Spiele nicht mehr mit Rubel bezahlt werden konnten, z.B. die “S.T.A.L.K.E.R.” - Serie, oder direkt Geld an die Ukraine spendeten (Entwickler von “This War of Mine” und “Frostpunk”). Dadurch fühlten sich vor allem russische Spieler hintergangen oder zu Unrecht bestraft. Aber auch andere Spieler beteiligten sich am Review Bombing, da sie der Meinung waren, dass sich Spieleentwickler aus politischen Angelegenheiten heraushalten sollten.
game_description: Cyberpunk 2077 is an open-world, action-adventure story set in Night City, a megalopolis obsessed with power, glamour and body modification. Assume the role of V, a mercenary outlaw going after a one-of-a-kind implant that is the key to immortality. You can customize your character’s cyberware, skillset and playstyle, and explore a vast city where the choices you make shape the story and the world around you. Become a cyberpunk, an urban mercenary equipped with cybernetic enhancements and build your legend on the streets of Night City. Take the riskiest job of your life and go after a prototype implant that is the key to immortality.
text_cleaned: f*ck politics in games! f*ck cdpr! polish corrupt developers go to the ass!

review: Does a good job at setting the scene for new Witcher fans; there are a lot of journal entries in the game that help with understanding the world and how it works. Mechanically the game mediocre at best, however the world building and story were interesting enough to keep me playing. I got the feeling that the Netflix series was true to this first game in many ways; meet Vessemir and you'll get what I mean. One of my favorite moments was when a simple innkeeper tells the story of a witcher princess sorceress as best he can, without remembering the names of the people involved. To this Geralt, who has no memory of his past, says "A witcher princess sorceress? Isn't that a bit much?".

game_description: Become The Witcher, Geralt of Rivia, a legendary monster slayer caught in a web of intrigue woven by forces vying for control of the world. Make difficult decisions and live with the consequences in a game that will immerse you in an extraordinary tale like no other.

review:
If you like figuring out scenarios and running trial and error simulations of the end of the world, this game is for you.
It's a cold day in hell before I stop playing this game.

review: Very heavy and deep atmosphere. Didn't play with any mods, exept one which allows you to change FoV, and still had a very bug free experience despite what I've heard online. It even looks fairly decend for its age, especially with max settings and the built-in DX11 Lighting. Definitely worth it!

review:
Oh yeah, you know what? Go to hell!
Since when have games been associated with politics? Why are Russian gamers worse than others? How are they related to government decisions? And why did it become normal to hate all Russian people? This is already discrimination based on nationality. You just rake everyone under the same brush! Damn racists! Of the Russian gamers, no one supports what the Russian government is doing now.
Didn't expect this from CDPR. Went to delete your damn games. Good luck in creating Polish shooters!

review:
CDPR, where were you when the Belarusians came to agree on localization. When we tried to build a good relationship. We've heard rejections on all your projects.
Did you support Belarusians in 2020? Where and how? It wasn't.
Why are you punishing people who are now helping Ukrainians in every possible way?

And if you add the right mods, this game really reaches the pinnacle of gaming.

game_description: Cyberpunk 2077 is an open-world, action-adventure story set in Night City, a megalopolis obsessed with power, glamour and body modification. Assume the role of V, a mercenary outlaw going after a one-of-a-kind implant that is the key to immortality. You can customize your character’s cyberware, skillset and playstyle, and explore a vast city where the choices you make shape the story and the world around you. Become a cyberpunk, an urban mercenary equipped with cybernetic enhancements and build your legend on the streets of Night City. Take the riskiest job of your life and go after a prototype implant that is the key to immortality.

game_description: Cyberpunk 2077 is an open-world, action-adventure story set in Night City, a megalopolis obsessed with power, glamour and body modification. Assume the role of V, a mercenary outlaw going after a one-of-a-kind implant that is the key to immortality. You can customize your character’s cyberware, skillset and playstyle, and explore a vast city where the choices you make shape the story and the world around you. Become a cyberpunk, an urban mercenary equipped with cybernetic enhancements and build your legend on the streets of Night City. Take the riskiest job of your life and go after a prototype implant that is the key to immortality.

review:
The game started with a good intro to put you into the mood. the music is great, the writing is superb and the voice acting was top notch. The gameplay is incredibly fun as well with many possibilities and decks you could make (Havent played GWENT before didnt know I was missing out on this). 
Towards the end some puzzles get tedious and some fights a bit drawn out but overall the experience is still fun and immersive. Some game design choices though really held this game back but nothing too devastating, things such as the extreme slow movement on the map, The inability to save multiple files, I get the effect this has on making your choices feel irreversible and that they matter but it can backfire - this is specially bad because a misclick could ruin the entire immersion and my choice. I did forego some of those shortcomings, specially when I saw the hilarious and awesome easter eggs, if theres anything to encourage you to explore that would be the first thing on the list.
TLDR;
Pros: 
- Great Story
- Great Voice acting
- Fun gameplay
Cons:
- Slow movement and sometimes slow gameplay.
- No multiple saves.
- Some options dont say what is written.

review:
Doesn't feel very "witcher"-y.  Card game is just OK; it's very straightforward, and you don't get enough deck-building choices to get much joy out of that.  Majority of battles are literally puzzles, or feel like puzzles/gimmicks rather than "battles against an opponent".  I want a game where I explore around unlocking cards to build my weird gimmick deck; you don't get nearly enough cards or choices to do that.  You get to customize a set deck.  A little.
Quite often the puzzles hinge on poorly translated rules text - card or scenario mechanics that behave in ways that are undefined, or do not match the text you're given.
Story is boringly, hilariously grim-dark.  Oh, you saved a dog?  It's Hitler's dog and it's a spy and it bites a child and it's all your fault.  After 3 or 4 rounds of that it doesn't feel like a shocking betrayal, it just isn't anything.   Your choices aren't real or meaningful, you're just picking door 1 or door 2 - and behind each of them is another betrayal or dead friend or tortured peasant and none of it is written well enough for you to care.

text_cleaned: does not feel very witcher -y. card game is just ok; it is very straightforward, and you do not get enough deck-building choices to get much joy out of that. majority of battles are literally puzzles, or feel like puzzles/gimmicks rather than battles against an opponent . want game where explore around unlocking cards to build my weird gimmick deck; you do not get nearly enough cards or choices to do that. you get to customize set deck. little. quite often the puzzles hinge on poorly translated rules text - card or scenario mechanics that behave in ways that are undefined, or do not match the text you are given. story is boringly, hilariously grim-dark. oh, you saved dog? it is hitler dog and it is spy and it bites child and it is all your fault. after three or four rounds of that it does not feel like shocking betrayal, it just is not anything. your choices are not real or meaningful, you are just picking door one or door two - and behind each of them is another betrayal or dead friend or tortured peasant and none of it is written well enough for you to care.

review:
Well, I really like The Witcher, the story in both 1, 2 and 3 are wonderful, perfect scripts, captivating characters, a really amazing world well made and very adaptable to the game, but the gameplay sucks, even though the game is from 2007, I think CD Projekt didn't pay much attention to the gameplay, if you (gamers) can handle all the negativity of the gameplay you will have an amazing game to enjoy.
OK. But I'm writing this analysis and negatively because I can not accept this nonsense that is mixing politics with games (and before some assholes comes here try to tell me that the government receives taxes from the sale of games, do you really think these sales can sustain a government? i dont't think so, it's insignificant compared to what these NATO dogs buy, oil and gas). So CD Projekt, please explain to me, what is the meaning of these sanctions that will hit only gamers and perhaps their only escape valve, explains to me what is the point of prohibiting them from playing? virtual signaling? congratulations you have now, or do you expect a gamer revolution? are all gamers going to arm themselves and get Putin out of power? the stone in the road of the United States in its unceasing quest for global domination. You are part of this rotten Western media, in the next war caused by the "Savior of the World" United States, in a Middle Eastern country that no one cares about, because it's not Europe and there are no blonde people, I hope you establish sanctions too, in the same way that you are doing now, after all, if you sanction a country that caused a war, why not sanction all the other countries that cause wars? 
One thing I'm sure of, I'm never going to give you my money again. Because I don't know if I'm ever going to be sanctioned by you just for being born in my own country and take the blame for the acts of the world's rulers.
SHAME ON YOU CD PROJEKT!!

CD Projekt Red (CDPR), ihre Spiele nicht mehr mit Rubel bezahlt werden konnten, z.B. die “S.T.A.L.K.E.R.” - Serie, oder direkt Geld an die Ukraine spendeten (Entwickler von “This War of Mine” und “Frostpunk”). Dadurch fühlten sich vor allem russische Spieler hintergangen oder zu Unrecht bestraft. Aber auch andere Spieler beteiligten sich am Review Bombing, da sie der Meinung waren, dass sich Spieleentwickler aus politischen Angelegenheiten heraushalten sollten.
game_description: With the Empire attacking the Kingdoms of the North and the Wild Hunt, a cavalcade of ghastly riders,  breathing down your neck, the only way to survive is to fight back. As Geralt of Rivia, a master swordsman and monster hunter, leave none of your enemies standing. Explore a gigantic open world, slay beasts and decide the fates of whole communities with your actions, all in a genuine next generation format.

game_description: Cyberpunk 2077 is an open-world, action-adventure story set in Night City, a megalopolis obsessed with power, glamour and body modification. Assume the role of V, a mercenary outlaw going after a one-of-a-kind implant that is the key to immortality. You can customize your character’s cyberware, skillset and playstyle, and explore a vast city where the choices you make shape the story and the world around you. Become a cyberpunk, an urban mercenary equipped with cybernetic enhancements and build your legend on the streets of Night City. Take the riskiest job of your life and go after a prototype implant that is the key to immortality.

review:
the TL;DR: it's probably safe to buy now, maybe wait for a sale. great game with some flaws.
specs:
AMD ryzen 5 3600
16 gb ram
RX 570 8 gb
I feel it is important for this review to start off with my specs. I'm not running anything super high end, but definitely not low end either. For AMD cards it only works with driver 21.10.2 so if you're on something newer and don't want to rollback drivers skip this game until it works with current drivers.
I'll be honest I had never heard of this game until of it's shit show of a release so I had no hype for it. I had bought a physical copy of the witcher 3 on switch around 2018~2019 due to hearing all that CDPR had included and wanted to support that kind of pro customer move. that has been my extent with CDPR until now. 
After starting it on xbox due to the free trial I immediately fell in love with the world of cyberpunk 2077. Though that controller sucks for aiming and thankfully the PC version allows for mouse input while using a controller for amazing gyro aim compatibility.
graphically this game looks great and thanks to fidelityFX runs great. story wise it's really immersive and very well written.
as for glitches in my first ~12 hours I've ran into a couple minor graphical issues. people walking into a wall for less than a sec/ vibrating rubble. though it's never enough to pull me out of the experience and honestly the vibrating rubble at the end of act 1 fits very well an IMO helps sell the scene.
I've only experienced 1 crash and I didn't lose much progress.

CD Projekt Red (CDPR), ihre Spiele nicht mehr mit Rubel bezahlt werden konnten, z.B. die “S.T.A.L.K.E.R.” - Serie, oder direkt Geld an die Ukraine spendeten (Entwickler von “This War of Mine” und “Frostpunk”). Dadurch fühlten sich vor allem russische Spieler hintergangen oder zu Unrecht bestraft. Aber auch andere Spieler beteiligten sich am Review Bombing, da sie der Meinung waren, dass sich Spieleentwickler aus politischen Angelegenheiten heraushalten sollten.

review:
Thank you GSC Game World. Your games gave me an unforgettable experience, revived and destroyed the bad legacy of the Slavic Games and just made my childhood more fun.
I went through many of your games, including Cossacks and others. You gave me love for the atmosphere, not for the graphics.
I've been waiting for your game for 15 years, and received only a spit in the face. I do not support the war on the territory of Ukraine, but I would rather support the war than that those who bought your games, who appreciated and loved your games, waiting for your games, you just abandoned and lied. You lied about being out of politics and you/your games will not be affected by politics. I am very sorry that you have stooped to the level of such cheap and salable products. I'm not saying that the stalker game series that came out is bad, it's just the only thing I can do so that even Western players from America, Europe and others know what GSC Game World did for their fans. Ratings don't mean anything here. This game and all the rest of the legends, no estimates will dispute this.

game_description: The player will become a stalker, a guy who earns money from shoveling embers out of infernal oven of Chernobyl Zone. Returning from the radioactivity-blazing Zone, he will sell anomalous formations to underground dealers and scientists in research camps on the Zone border. With the money procured, the player will purchase equipment, weapons and protective suits allowing him to reach previously inaccessible areas. This is a role-playing game without growing experience of your character, without changing characteristics and levels. We want the player to develop his real mastery, moreover Stalker is an FPS/RPG game and much depends on his ability to fight. [GSC Game World]

CD Projekt Red (CDPR), ihre Spiele nicht mehr mit Rubel bezahlt werden konnten, z.B. die “S.T.A.L.K.E.R.” - Serie, oder direkt Geld an die Ukraine spendeten (Entwickler von “This War of Mine” und “Frostpunk”). Aber auch andere Spieler beteiligten sich am Review Bombing, da sie der Meinung waren, dass sich Spieleentwickler aus politischen Angelegenheiten heraushalten sollten.
game_description: Cyberpunk 2077 is an open-world, action-adventure story set in Night City, a megalopolis obsessed with power, glamour and body modification. Assume the role of V, a mercenary outlaw going after a one-of-a-kind implant that is the key to immortality. You can customize your character’s cyberware, skillset and playstyle, and explore a vast city where the choices you make shape the story and the world around you. Become a cyberpunk, an urban mercenary equipped with cybernetic enhancements and build your legend on the streets of Night City. Take the riskiest job of your life and go after a prototype implant that is the key to immortality.

review:
One of the most engaging and interesting RPG's I've ever played, and I didn't even get to make a custom character. The Witcher 3 stands proudly above all other RPGs and rightfully so. Its brooding dark setting are beset by its colorful cast of characters and wonderful writing which can range from fairly generic at times to downright tear jerking.
Gameplay - From a gameplay perspective The Witcher 3 uses a very well fleshed out system of combat, magic, and dialogue to let the player cultivate their own unique experience within Geralt's story. The combat ranges from button mashy when fighting crowds, to creative and visceral when facing boss and monster with out ever feeling grindy or unsatisfying. Geralt controls well and depending on your temperament can be quite suave and even hilarious at times. There are plethora of system available in the game as well which help to supplement the overall experience. Except Gwent... I hate Gwent.  Crafting and forging not only give you stronger equipment but potions and  charms which can give you advantages against the men and monsters of this world.
Story - The story ranges from basic rpg go here do x formula to down right engage story lines for even some of the small quests. I often found myself compelled to complete quest with stale gameplay just to see the story outcome they would have, and I'm happy to say most are worth doing! While the main story line grows stale from time to time side quests do a great job of keeping you engaged with the game enough that it never feels like a slough or choir to complete. Although it is probably best to take your time with this one, and make sure to buy the GOTY edition for the DLCs.
Probably the most fun I've had with an RPG since Mass Effect and Fallout New Vegas, The Witcher 3 strikes a cord deep with anyone looking to lose themselves and many hour of their time in it wonderous and brutal world!
Gameplay: 9 (Only reason this gets a 9 is bc of gwent, I hate gwent)
Story:9
Enjoyment:10

game_description: With the Empire attacking the Kingdoms of the North and the Wild Hunt, a cavalcade of ghastly riders,  breathing down your neck, the only way to survive is to fight back. As Geralt of Rivia, a master swordsman and monster hunter, leave none of your enemies standing. Explore a gigantic open world, slay beasts and decide the fates of whole communities with your actions, all in a genuine next generation format.

Despite the fact that he was deceived by you. Yes, no one cares about my personal list as an opinion, well, let them. Now I will definitely circle the name in the list with a pen. Continue to expose yourself to those who you have not been for a long time, I will never take products from your company again, especially on pre-order. It's just that the people here are not to blame and can do nothing. Exactly the same as you before the release of Cp2077, don't you see the similarity. if you started to strike about the release of a raw game, you would immediately fly out of your office. It is a pity that everyone, like monkeys, picks up that heresy and repeats everything after the West. I have nothing more to add. Good luck.

CD Projekt Red (CDPR), ihre Spiele nicht mehr mit Rubel bezahlt werden konnten, z.B. die “S.T.A.L.K.E.R.” - Serie, oder direkt Geld an die Ukraine spendeten (Entwickler von “This War of Mine” und “Frostpunk”). Dadurch fühlten sich vor allem russische Spieler hintergangen oder zu Unrecht bestraft. Aber auch andere Spieler beteiligten sich am Review Bombing, da sie der Meinung waren, dass sich Spieleentwickler aus politischen Angelegenheiten heraushalten sollten.
game_description: S.T.A.L.K.E.R.: Clear Sky – standalone prequel for the acclaimed S.T.A.L.K.E.R.: Shadow of Chernobyl, which tells you story about the Clear Sky group, that want to research the Zone and understand it better.

game_description: Cyberpunk 2077 is an open-world, action-adventure story set in Night City, a megalopolis obsessed with power, glamour and body modification. Assume the role of V, a mercenary outlaw going after a one-of-a-kind implant that is the key to immortality. You can customize your character’s cyberware, skillset and playstyle, and explore a vast city where the choices you make shape the story and the world around you. Become a cyberpunk, an urban mercenary equipped with cybernetic enhancements and build your legend on the streets of Night City. Take the riskiest job of your life and go after a prototype implant that is the key to immortality.

review:
I got this game on sale for the price of a cup of coffee and let me tell you, it has the most awesome and engaging story. If you can look past the combat style (which you get used to) you will have so much fun in this game. And for its age it has held up well.
But I have be honest, the combat style got to me near the ending, I rushed to the end because of it and didn't quite understand the ending story. I am of to youtube to see what was it all about!
Anyway, if you got some spare cash and some free time, you will not regret getting this game

review:
An amazing journey of a monster hunter in every way possible.
The main story is very well made with a great cast of characters, and the writing is fantastic, everything in the game has depth to it.
The amount of content is absolutely ridiculous, at first you might get overwhelmed by all the activities the game throws at you, but exploring the map and doing side quests is definitely worth it, this game has perhaps the best side quests I've ever experienced, and the quest design is phenomenal.
The dialogue options are groundbreaking, almost every quest has different outcomes and interactions, it's insane. Your actions have consequences and if you're not careful, you can miss entire questlines that can alter your experience.
It's an all-around solid game, it does almost everything very well, except from the gameplay which is a little bit clunky so you'll have to get used to it, and some animations look weird.
The biggest problem I have with the game personally is the amount of filler and padding in the first half of the story, it takes way too long for it to pick up, but the last few hours are just incredible.
Also the boss fights are disappointingly simple and easy, no challenge whatsoever.
Top Tier Open World in my opinion, it's very enjoyable from start to finish, there are so many things to do in this game.
The Witcher 3: Wild Hunt achieved the impossible, it's unbelievable how a small Polish studio managed to create this monster of a videogame.
Final Rating: "Masterpiece" ~ 10/10.

game_description: With the Empire attacking the Kingdoms of the North and the Wild Hunt, a cavalcade of ghastly riders,  breathing down your neck, the only way to survive is to fight back. As Geralt of Rivia, a master swordsman and monster hunter, leave none of your enemies standing. Explore a gigantic open world, slay beasts and decide the fates of whole communities with your actions, all in a genuine next generation format.

review:
Witcher is a classic, single player RPG.  The graphics are phenomenal for the time, the player interface is particularly user friendly (on the PC, at least) , and the story arc is interesting.
If I had any complaint, it would be that, like many computer games, the "generic" monsters are a bit repetitive, and this is a game that kinda demands a lot of grinding, if you want a Geralt worthy of the title Witcher.

review: Writting a review at this point is not needed, buy this game if you love fantasy, deep stories that your actions shape and fun but at times challeging fight system. This game set the standard for other games and it will be remembered forever. I would say it's a must buy you have to live through this game atleast once in your life. I would even suggest getting the Witcher 2 first and playing that cause it will be more of your story how you want it and i promise you will hate leaving this world by the end cause it has so much soul and heart. This game is one of those THE GAMES that make you feel so many emotions and it invites you in into this dangerous fun world of a badass monster slayer. This game is Legendary get the dlc's too they are amazing aswell from me this game is a 11/10.

game_name_display: The Witcher 2: Assassins of Kings Enhanced Edition
review: Nice to meet you, CDPR.
review_bomb_reason: Kurz nach Beginn des Russland-Ukraine-Krieges im Februar 2022 entschieden sich einige Spieleentwickler dazu, sich klar gegen Russland zu positionieren, indem sie entweder ihre Spiele nicht mehr in Russland zum Verkauf anboten, z.B. CD Projekt Red (CDPR), ihre Spiele nicht mehr mit Rubel bezahlt werden konnten, z.B. die “S.T.A.L.K.E.R.” - Serie, oder direkt Geld an die Ukraine spendeten (Entwickler von “This War of Mine” und “Frostpunk”). Dadurch fühlten sich vor allem russische Spieler hintergangen oder zu Unrecht bestraft. Aber auch andere Spieler beteiligten sich am Review Bombing, da sie der Meinung waren, dass sich Spieleentwickler aus politischen Angelegenheiten heraushalten sollten.
game_description: A time of untold chaos has come. Mighty forces clash behind the scenes in a struggle for power and influence. The Northern Kingdoms mobilize for war. But armies on the march are not enough to stop a bloody conspiracy...

review: I had nerves of steel to tolerate your mistakes and jambs on the release, I waited a year and a half for normal patches for Cyberpunk, I waited more than a year for the next-gen version of the Witcher 3, when all my friends said that Cyberpunk was **** - I consoled myself as best I could. But there is a limit to everything - because you spat in the face of the entire Russian and Belarusian community for unleashing the so-called "war". Let me remind you, my dear Poles, that if the Soviet Union did not exist, your nation would have been exterminated long ago thanks to the efforts of ****, it was the Soviet army that entered Berlin and prevented fascism and genocide, especially of Jews. It was the Soviet Army that raised the flag over the Bundestag. And this is your gratitude? Shame. Moreover, we are simple players, simple countrymen like you.  I no longer have the strength and emotions to paint this text. You are the company that I will not support with a ruble, and I will dissuade familiar friends. After all, my friends were right, you are scammers who raised money on pre-orders and released a pre-alpha version of your under-product. I hope this is your last decision of the company before the collapse. All the bad things to you.

game_description: Cyberpunk 2077 is an open-world, action-adventure story set in Night City, a megalopolis obsessed with power, glamour and body modification. Assume the role of V, a mercenary outlaw going after a one-of-a-kind implant that is the key to immortality. You can customize your character’s cyberware, skillset and playstyle, and explore a vast city where the choices you make shape the story and the world around you. Become a cyberpunk, an urban mercenary equipped with cybernetic enhancements and build your legend on the streets of Night City. Take the riskiest job of your life and go after a prototype implant that is the key to immortality.

CD Projekt Red (CDPR), ihre Spiele nicht mehr mit Rubel bezahlt werden konnten, z.B. die “S.T.A.L.K.E.R.” - Serie, oder direkt Geld an die Ukraine spendeten (Entwickler von “This War of Mine” und “Frostpunk”). Dadurch fühlten sich vor allem russische Spieler hintergangen oder zu Unrecht bestraft. Aber auch andere Spieler beteiligten sich am Review Bombing, da sie der Meinung waren, dass sich Spieleentwickler aus politischen Angelegenheiten heraushalten sollten.
game_description: S.T.A.L.K.E.R.: Shadow of Chernobyl tells a story about survival in the Zone – a very dangerous place, where you fear not only the radiation, anomalies and deadly creatures, but other S.T.A.L.K.E.R.s, who have their own goals and wishes.
text_cleaned: first stalker game and absolute blast with mysterious story.
text_preprocessed: first stalker game and absolute blast with mysterious story .

review:
The best I've ever played
The atmosphere is so good and managed to immerse me so well 
 
The AI in this game feel so alive.
I really love artifact hunting, the best to make greens 🤑💸 
 
The story isn't that interesting to me, but I don't really care anyway since the gameplay is so good.
 
8/10 will recommend. If you're new in this game, please aim for the head

game_description: Cyberpunk 2077 is an open-world, action-adventure story set in Night City, a megalopolis obsessed with power, glamour and body modification. Assume the role of V, a mercenary outlaw going after a one-of-a-kind implant that is the key to immortality. You can customize your character’s cyberware, skillset and playstyle, and explore a vast city where the choices you make shape the story and the world around you. Become a cyberpunk, an urban mercenary equipped with cybernetic enhancements and build your legend on the streets of Night City. Take the riskiest job of your life and go after a prototype implant that is the key to immortality.

review: While not the same as Gwent played within the main Witcher series, this adaptation is features gripping mechanics. With a veritable dictionary of keywords, a handful of factions (ripe with their own strategies and play-styles), and a progression not reliant on micro-transactions, Gwent is a top tier game worth hours of play.

review: I find the game immersive and enjoyable - you can play it your way. It performs very well on my high-end gaming PC and looks great. It's worth keeping a full set of key command references available while you're learning the controls. I would say that after early problems, the game feels like the developers are properly investing in it and it's worth sticking with.

review:
When you consider this game is from 2008, it's mindblowing. Imagine being in 2008 and playing this. Even today, this game still holds up and still runs on modern OS.
It doesn't have all the graphical eye candy but the game still is fun. Just goes to show that time, care, and pride put into a game can overcome big budget production value games.
review_bomb_reason: Kurz nach Beginn des Russland-Ukraine-Krieges im Februar 2022 entschieden sich einige Spieleentwickler dazu, sich klar gegen Russland zu positionieren, indem sie entweder ihre Spiele nicht mehr in Russland zum Verkauf anboten, z.B. CD Projekt Red (CDPR), ihre Spiele nicht mehr mit Rubel bezahlt werden konnten, z.B. die “S.T.A.L.K.E.R.” - Serie, oder direkt Geld an die Ukraine spendeten (Entwickler von “This War of Mine” und “Frostpunk”). Dadurch fühlten sich vor allem russische Spieler hintergangen oder zu Unrecht bestraft. Aber auch andere Spieler beteiligten sich am Review Bombing, da sie der Meinung waren, dass sich Spieleentwickler aus politischen Angelegenheiten heraushalten sollten.

game_description: Cyberpunk 2077 is an open-world, action-adventure story set in Night City, a megalopolis obsessed with power, glamour and body modification. Assume the role of V, a mercenary outlaw going after a one-of-a-kind implant that is the key to immortality. You can customize your character’s cyberware, skillset and playstyle, and explore a vast city where the choices you make shape the story and the world around you. Become a cyberpunk, an urban mercenary equipped with cybernetic enhancements and build your legend on the streets of Night City. Take the riskiest job of your life and go after a prototype implant that is the key to immortality.

The game is ok, but only if you are a witcher fan.

game_description: Cyberpunk 2077 is an open-world, action-adventure story set in Night City, a megalopolis obsessed with power, glamour and body modification. Assume the role of V, a mercenary outlaw going after a one-of-a-kind implant that is the key to immortality. You can customize your character’s cyberware, skillset and playstyle, and explore a vast city where the choices you make shape the story and the world around you. Become a cyberpunk, an urban mercenary equipped with cybernetic enhancements and build your legend on the streets of Night City. Take the riskiest job of your life and go after a prototype implant that is the key to immortality.

review:
Adequate and thinking people will never go to the streets just because you are pushing them so diligently and vilely to do so. You use sneaky manipulations, knowing full well that you are influencing ordinary people. In your message, you openly admit that you want to manipulate other people's behavior, urging gamers "to talk" about what is happening in the center of Europe. But we must say only whatever you and your Western masters find convenient. It doesn't work like that. All you have achieved is an increase hatred in this World.
Games are outside of politics, sports are outside of politics. Shame on you, CD PROJEKT RED! How low have you fallen! But not low enough. There is still something to strive for and the bottom to reach through. Like those who decided to humiliate the russian athletes at the 2022 Paralympic Games.

Assume the role of V, a mercenary outlaw going after a one-of-a-kind implant that is the key to immortality. You can customize your character’s cyberware, skillset and playstyle, and explore a vast city where the choices you make shape the story and the world around you. Become a cyberpunk, an urban mercenary equipped with cybernetic enhancements and build your legend on the streets of Night City. Take the riskiest job of your life and go after a prototype implant that is the key to immortality.

review:
Maybe not the most popular of the STALKER series, but still a great game. I've spent hundreds of hours in it (had a disc version since day one).
Clear Sky is much more action-packed than Shadow of Chernobyl and doesn't have the engaging quest system as Call of Prypiat does, but it - despite being released in 2008 - still looks gorgeous artistically (locations like Red Forest and Limansk are shamelessly atmospheric and detailed even in 2022), has tons of guns with a diverse upgrade system and the best gunplay in the series. And the War of Factions AI featured in this game generates tons of unexpected and fun gameplay situations.
If you want a STALKER game with a solid progression system and a lot of smart enemies to shoot at, Clear Sky is your top pick in the series. Also, traditionally, there are hundreds of gameplay, visual, and story mods you can instal once you've done with vanilla.
Слава Україні!

review: This game is flat out amazing. the only part of the game i found dislike-able in any way were the unskippable cutscenes. The story is amazing, the satisfaction after surviving in a world such as this is endlessly satisfying, and its unique. Ive only gotten through the normal story, but that alone was enough to keep me entertained for hours at a time. Its one of those games where even if you fail, or lose in some way, its just as enjoyable to try it again in a different way. Definitely one of my favorites, even with only 17 hours played. I cant say much about the side-stories or endless mode just yet, but the game itself is great. Ive already recommended it to two or three other people, and i would still recommend it to more.

text_cleaned: this game is flat out amazing. the only part of the game found dislike-able in any way were the unskippable cutscenes. the story is amazing, the satisfaction after surviving in world such as this is endlessly satisfying, and its unique. ive only gotten through the normal story, but that alone was enough to keep me entertained for hours at time. its one of those games where even if you fail, or lose in some way, its just as enjoyable to try it again in different way. definitely one of my favorites, even with only seventeen hours played. cant say much about the side-stories or endless mode just yet, but the game itself is great. ive already recommended it to two or three other people, and would still recommend it to more.

review: Best story about Chernobyl, and good RPG, cant wait to see the second part.
review_bomb_reason: Kurz nach Beginn des Russland-Ukraine-Krieges im Februar 2022 entschieden sich einige Spieleentwickler dazu, sich klar gegen Russland zu positionieren, indem sie entweder ihre Spiele nicht mehr in Russland zum Verkauf anboten, z.B. CD Projekt Red (CDPR), ihre Spiele nicht mehr mit Rubel bezahlt werden konnten, z.B. die “S.T.A.L.K.E.R.” - Serie, oder direkt Geld an die Ukraine spendeten (Entwickler von “This War of Mine” und “Frostpunk”). Dadurch fühlten sich vor allem russische Spieler hintergangen oder zu Unrecht bestraft. Aber auch andere Spieler beteiligten sich am Review Bombing, da sie der Meinung waren, dass sich Spieleentwickler aus politischen Angelegenheiten heraushalten sollten.
game_description: S.T.A.L.K.E.R.: Call of Pripyat is the direct sequel of the S.T.A.L.K.E.R.: Shadow of Chernobyl. As a Major Alexander Degtyarev you should investigate the crash of the governmental helicopters around the Zone and find out, what happened there.

game_description: Cyberpunk 2077 is an open-world, action-adventure story set in Night City, a megalopolis obsessed with power, glamour and body modification. Assume the role of V, a mercenary outlaw going after a one-of-a-kind implant that is the key to immortality. You can customize your character’s cyberware, skillset and playstyle, and explore a vast city where the choices you make shape the story and the world around you. Become a cyberpunk, an urban mercenary equipped with cybernetic enhancements and build your legend on the streets of Night City. Take the riskiest job of your life and go after a prototype implant that is the key to immortality.

review: The Witcher 3: Wild Hunt is an action role-playing game developed by Polish developer CD Projekt Red, and first published in 2015. It is the sequel to the 2011 game The Witcher 2: Assassins of Kings and the third and final main game in The Witcher video game series, played in an open world with a third-person perspective. The games are based on The Witcher series of fantasy novels written by Andrzej Sapkowski. The game takes place in a fictional fantasy world based on Slavic mythology. Players control Geralt of Rivia, a monster slayer for hire known as a Witcher, and search for his adopted daughter, who is on the run from the otherworldly Wild Hunt. Players battle the game's many dangers with weapons and magic, interact with non-player characters, and complete quests to acquire experience points and gold, which are used to increase Geralt's abilities and purchase equipment. The game's story has three possible endings, determined by the player's choices at key points in the narrative.

Explore a gigantic open world, slay beasts and decide the fates of whole communities with your actions, all in a genuine next generation format.

review:
I recommend this game BUT...
This game has horrible combat. It's so bad. Gerald absolutely can not swing his sword normally. He has to do this twirlie thing where he spins and dances around before he swings. It is literally like having a full second of input lag. Meanwhile, the enemies just attack as normal and can damage you even if you press the attack button first. I remember fighting a pack of wolves and laughing as I watched Gerald dance around the battlefield like a ballerina. I felt like the wolves were laughing at him too. Gerald also constantly falls down stairs. What a clumsy fool. I was on a boat with Yen and went down to the lower deck and Gerald fell down the stairs right off the side of a mountain to his death. He also can't jump in combat to get over obstacles so a fence or a rock will block him...ugh.
This game has more map points than a Ubisoft game and I usually do ALL the Ubisoft map points. I did all of them except the ones in the water in Skellige. I gave up after like 12 of them constantly guiding the boat, shooting the sirens then diving down in the water. Rinse and repeat. It's so time consuming with little to no reward.
The best sidequests I have ever seen in a game are here and the open world is amazing. The clunky and stiff movement and combat really hinders this game for me though...but I still recommend it.

review:
CDPR has come a [b]LOOOOONG[/b] way on this game!
I originally pre-ordered this for my PS4 and played it the day of launch.  It. . . well, it [i]ran[/i], but it had definite issues.  I won't elaborate.  We all know how rough this was out of the gate, especially for the now last-gen consoles.
Right now I'm running this on a decent pre-built gaming rig (Cyber-Power), and while there are times my fans sound like a 747 taking off, I have yet to have [i]any[/i] performance issues, crashes, bugs, or so much as a long load time (on the PC).  They're still very much working on this game, and there are still some QOL improvements they're making (scuttlebutt says they're making outfits toggle-able so you won't have to look like an eclectic homeless person to have the current best armor).  I think it speaks volumes that they've had their noses to the grindstone, finishing the game and working hard on getting updates out in a very timely fashion.
So yes, I highly recommend this game.  I'm almost wondering if they'll do a re-release when it's finally done to maybe recoup some of their initial losses as well as to celebrate the finished product in a manner fitting to a game of it's caliber.

game_description: Cyberpunk 2077 is an open-world, action-adventure story set in Night City, a megalopolis obsessed with power, glamour and body modification. Assume the role of V, a mercenary outlaw going after a one-of-a-kind implant that is the key to immortality. You can customize your character’s cyberware, skillset and playstyle, and explore a vast city where the choices you make shape the story and the world around you. Become a cyberpunk, an urban mercenary equipped with cybernetic enhancements and build your legend on the streets of Night City. Take the riskiest job of your life and go after a prototype implant that is the key to immortality.

review: Someone said that games are not politics and military conflicts, too. And it turned out that GSC supports both, and even encourages these actions. And Russophobia on their part. And the ban of a new game on the territory. But when there were donations for a new part, they did not look at who gave them this money and again the Russians. Did they know that a huge part of the players in the Russian-speaking segment, including from Russia? Eh... It's a pity that such a beloved studio turned out to be a hypocritical community and Russophobia and hatred of Russians flourishing there. And what about the past parts? The third part of the franchise turned out to be normal, not good, but you can also buy a good one, but the past parts are a HORROR in all respects, except for the physics of bodies and the atmosphere, although the atmosphere is a purely subjective opinion of it, the players themselves never invented it, if not for the modders, the series would have already been completely bent. Conclusion the third part is normal, but the last one is a fierce shit that it's even a shame to play. because of the clumsiness of the world and the game engine.

review: Awesome game and they don't support russian imperialism - win-win situation
review_bomb_reason: Kurz nach Beginn des Russland-Ukraine-Krieges im Februar 2022 entschieden sich einige Spieleentwickler dazu, sich klar gegen Russland zu positionieren, indem sie entweder ihre Spiele nicht mehr in Russland zum Verkauf anboten, z.B. CD Projekt Red (CDPR), ihre Spiele nicht mehr mit Rubel bezahlt werden konnten, z.B. die “S.T.A.L.K.E.R.” - Serie, oder direkt Geld an die Ukraine spendeten (Entwickler von “This War of Mine” und “Frostpunk”). Dadurch fühlten sich vor allem russische Spieler hintergangen oder zu Unrecht bestraft. Aber auch andere Spieler beteiligten sich am Review Bombing, da sie der Meinung waren, dass sich Spieleentwickler aus politischen Angelegenheiten heraushalten sollten.
game_description: A time of untold chaos has come. Mighty forces clash behind the scenes in a struggle for power and influence. The Northern Kingdoms mobilize for war. But armies on the march are not enough to stop a bloody conspiracy...

game_description: Cyberpunk 2077 is an open-world, action-adventure story set in Night City, a megalopolis obsessed with power, glamour and body modification. Assume the role of V, a mercenary outlaw going after a one-of-a-kind implant that is the key to immortality. You can customize your character’s cyberware, skillset and playstyle, and explore a vast city where the choices you make shape the story and the world around you. Become a cyberpunk, an urban mercenary equipped with cybernetic enhancements and build your legend on the streets of Night City. Take the riskiest job of your life and go after a prototype implant that is the key to immortality.

review:
I got this game in pre-order. I wasn't able to play properly at all since release. Now that patch 1.5 is out, I can finally play the way I wanted to without the stuttering and freezes. There are a few bugs and hiccups (randomly getting teleported inside buildings or falling into the void) but they don't occur always. I hope CDPR keeps improving the game until it becomes what they envisioned it to be. 
Please bring gangwars and factions. I want to be a MT or TT. Some story changes is nice, like having more CORPO options with corpo V. Or maybe, more lifepaths, like, a VETERAN from the last war.

review: Graphics in base game are a little dated since its old, even with a 1650, it really overheats the laptop if you play on 1920x1080. But overall the gameplay is great, the atmosphere it builds is very fun to be in and the soundtrack is phenomenal.
review_bomb_reason: Kurz nach Beginn des Russland-Ukraine-Krieges im Februar 2022 entschieden sich einige Spieleentwickler dazu, sich klar gegen Russland zu positionieren, indem sie entweder ihre Spiele nicht mehr in Russland zum Verkauf anboten, z.B. CD Projekt Red (CDPR), ihre Spiele nicht mehr mit Rubel bezahlt werden konnten, z.B. die “S.T.A.L.K.E.R.” - Serie, oder direkt Geld an die Ukraine spendeten (Entwickler von “This War of Mine” und “Frostpunk”). Dadurch fühlten sich vor allem russische Spieler hintergangen oder zu Unrecht bestraft. Aber auch andere Spieler beteiligten sich am Review Bombing, da sie der Meinung waren, dass sich Spieleentwickler aus politischen Angelegenheiten heraushalten sollten.
game_description: S.T.A.L.K.E.R.: Call of Pripyat is the direct sequel of the S.T.A.L.K.E.R.: Shadow of Chernobyl. As a Major Alexander Degtyarev you should investigate the crash of the governmental helicopters around the Zone and find out, what happened there.

review: This is my first game review ever in fact i made this account just to rate Cyberpunk after patch 1.5, I am a huge Witcher 3 fanboy and i am just going to say this about CP 2077 that it is a massive waste of time and patch 1.5 has not saved it, first thing notice is that the physics are so off putting when just walking over a dead body kicks it meters away the vehicles are the same a ( a  4000 pound car won't budge if i slightly nudge in it real life CDPR!) , Second, Why does flamboyant appearance options in the character builder even matter for a game that can only be played in first person that is just so dumb.. The NPC is still so unintelligent, the NPC in the Witcher 3 was infinitely better, when bumping into  pedestrians you phase through them and when you look back at them they don't seem to care as if nothing ever happened like you were some kind of ghost; When you are in a mission and reload to the last checkpoint when you flatline there are plenty of times where you reset literally more than a minute away from where you died ,so if you die a lot of times in certain missions you waste a lot of time. Melee combat  looks too goofy for a game trying to be immersive, the developers loaded in two punching animations for the game, no kicks, no uppercuts, no variations everything you can see V do in first person feels so robotic. Didn't even buy this game till patch 1.5 i still have a lot to get off issues with the game. I stopped playing the game when my save file for 5 hours got lost,  i don't know whether it was CDPR or epic games that had an issue it doesn't matter because i don't want to play the game anymore, unless of course some massive update miraculously fixes things and saves the game probably in five years.... even then the best i would ever give this game is a 5 rating. If you value your time I recommend that you do not play this game.

game_description: Cyberpunk 2077 is an open-world, action-adventure story set in Night City, a megalopolis obsessed with power, glamour and body modification. Assume the role of V, a mercenary outlaw going after a one-of-a-kind implant that is the key to immortality. You can customize your character’s cyberware, skillset and playstyle, and explore a vast city where the choices you make shape the story and the world around you. Become a cyberpunk, an urban mercenary equipped with cybernetic enhancements and build your legend on the streets of Night City. Take the riskiest job of your life and go after a prototype implant that is the key to immortality.

review:
There have always been slogans that sports are out of politics, games are out of politics. It's funny when everyone gives a **** about it. We, represented by Russians and Belarusians, will survive such an **** event, you made. Will play tetris.
This is a hysteria of sanctions that will not lead to the end of the conflict (I condemn Putin's policy, but I have no choice in this country). Also i condemn the black PR, and kind of **** which you showed off.
P.S. Be sure to make the next dlc about evil Russians, you already have Nadezhda Tiurina and Mikhail Akulov as main caracters.

game_description: Cyberpunk 2077 is an open-world, action-adventure story set in Night City, a megalopolis obsessed with power, glamour and body modification. Assume the role of V, a mercenary outlaw going after a one-of-a-kind implant that is the key to immortality. You can customize your character’s cyberware, skillset and playstyle, and explore a vast city where the choices you make shape the story and the world around you. Become a cyberpunk, an urban mercenary equipped with cybernetic enhancements and build your legend on the streets of Night City. Take the riskiest job of your life and go after a prototype implant that is the key to immortality.

review:
I ignored the hype that encompassed this game when it first came out so I could enjoy it later, and I'm very glad I did. Many of the original problems upon release have been fixed and the game is extremely enjoyable. The story line is excellent with an interesting plot. The gameplay is quick and fun and flexible enough to allow you to do things your way, either via stealth, netrunning, or out-right blasting. 
The newest patch fixes some of the critiques I had: you can now change your hairstyle/color, driving is easier, and there are more clothing options. 
The game is not free of bugs, but the game crippling ones that it first experienced at launch are long gone and most of them can be worked around. Overall I give it a 4.5/5 and recommend it on anybody's play list as long as they are of age. It's definitely rated M for Mature audiences.

review:
I have always supported the Witcher developers, I myself live in Kazakhstan, but I pay for purchases in rubles, but now the company's activities are crossing all boundaries, they have not just blocked access to purchases, they also want to roll back Cyberpunk 2077 to the initial version of the game. It is unacceptable for developers to get into politics. For example, my friend from Russia - what should he do? And what should I do? After all, I have an account in rubles.
I believe that there should be no politics in games!!!
Spread this information wherever possible, let everyone put dislikes.

review:
Gotta say this is the most complicated single player game I've ever played & easily stands on par with industry greatest hits like RDR2, TLOU2 & GOW.
There is a vast area in the game that is not utilized & knowing the fate of characters in main story, It will be really interesting to see the approach CDPR takes in making story DLC/expansions.
*Still loads polishing needs to be done :-) 
*Big companies should stop being greedy.
 A masterpiece. 10/10

review: great game, amazing atmosphere and some of the missions are genuinely terryfying
review_bomb_reason: Kurz nach Beginn des Russland-Ukraine-Krieges im Februar 2022 entschieden sich einige Spieleentwickler dazu, sich klar gegen Russland zu positionieren, indem sie entweder ihre Spiele nicht mehr in Russland zum Verkauf anboten, z.B. CD Projekt Red (CDPR), ihre Spiele nicht mehr mit Rubel bezahlt werden konnten, z.B. die “S.T.A.L.K.E.R.” - Serie, oder direkt Geld an die Ukraine spendeten (Entwickler von “This War of Mine” und “Frostpunk”). Dadurch fühlten sich vor allem russische Spieler hintergangen oder zu Unrecht bestraft. Aber auch andere Spieler beteiligten sich am Review Bombing, da sie der Meinung waren, dass sich Spieleentwickler aus politischen Angelegenheiten heraushalten sollten.
game_description: S.T.A.L.K.E.R.: Shadow of Chernobyl tells a story about survival in the Zone – a very dangerous place, where you fear not only the radiation, anomalies and deadly creatures, but other S.T.A.L.K.E.R.s, who have their own goals and wishes.

review:
Good with a few gripes:
Why are the technology upgrade explanations hidden until you unlock the tier? I'm not about to invest hours into a campaign just to find out what's hidden in tier 5 and 6 (thank you, Internet).And in general, the explanations for each structure were a little skimpy. 
Why are housing structures the only building that you can monitor the temperature of in the Economy tab?
Knowing how long a sawmill will last is ambiguous when you build the structure. Obviously it's variable depending on workforce, hours etc. but at least show me a numerical value when I'm about to build so I can compare forest plots.    
The temple, Faith Keepers, and other Book of Law unlockable structures are not listed in the Economy window. I had a doozy of time trying to find them once my map filled up. Also, no notification option for when the ability cooldown period is up? Come on now.  
Why do the outpost teams disappear from the map on their trip to the outpost?
I could go on but then I might start rethinking my thumbs up 🤔

review: Highly addictive , it is set in the Witcher fantasy world . Preplanning about one's strategy and tactics is essential .One treat from me : There are dozens of mechanics in this game - and beside the faction of your cards , building your deck around your main player's ability , and just one mechanic sometimes is not enough . I've yet to encounter an online card game with so thoroughly developed mechanics , and with such depth of immersion ...

review: There are still glitches in the game, but nothing game breaking. Not the best CDP game considering I played through Witcher 3 three to four times. game_description: Cyberpunk 2077 is an open-world, action-adventure story set in Night City, a megalopolis obsessed with power, glamour and body modification. Assume the role of V, a mercenary outlaw going after a one-of-a-kind implant that is the key to immortality. You can customize your character’s cyberware, skillset and playstyle, and explore a vast city where the choices you make shape the story and the world around you. Become a cyberpunk, an urban mercenary equipped with cybernetic enhancements and build your legend on the streets of Night City. Take the riskiest job of your life and go after a prototype implant that is the key to immortality.

review:
I really love the world of the witcher and this game lets me experience it in its original form.
that this game is very old doesn't matter, and its graphics are good enough, especially for weaker systems:
you could litteraly play it on an microwave and it would be as beautiful and fascinating.
10/10

You can customize your character’s cyberware, skillset and playstyle, and explore a vast city where the choices you make shape the story and the world around you. Become a cyberpunk, an urban mercenary equipped with cybernetic enhancements and build your legend on the streets of Night City. Take the riskiest job of your life and go after a prototype implant that is the key to immortality.
text_cleaned: played it at release despite criticism plugged in over one hundred and twentyhrs, plan to return to it soon and enjoy the new patch content on new playthrough. still have lot of admiration for cdpr and thier work. respect, glory to ukraine.

game_name_display: The Witcher 2: Assassins of Kings Enhanced Edition
review: Not as good as the others two witcher games, but still very good. The game is shorter but plot/characters are still very good. But something was missing in this game and for me it is not as memorable as the other two. 7/10
review_bomb_reason: Kurz nach Beginn des Russland-Ukraine-Krieges im Februar 2022 entschieden sich einige Spieleentwickler dazu, sich klar gegen Russland zu positionieren, indem sie entweder ihre Spiele nicht mehr in Russland zum Verkauf anboten, z.B. CD Projekt Red (CDPR), ihre Spiele nicht mehr mit Rubel bezahlt werden konnten, z.B. die “S.T.A.L.K.E.R.” - Serie, oder direkt Geld an die Ukraine spendeten (Entwickler von “This War of Mine” und “Frostpunk”). Dadurch fühlten sich vor allem russische Spieler hintergangen oder zu Unrecht bestraft. Aber auch andere Spieler beteiligten sich am Review Bombing, da sie der Meinung waren, dass sich Spieleentwickler aus politischen Angelegenheiten heraushalten sollten.
game_description: A time of untold chaos has come. Mighty forces clash behind the scenes in a struggle for power and influence. The Northern Kingdoms mobilize for war. But armies on the march are not enough to stop a bloody conspiracy...
